Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2014 06:28PM sistagirl wrote: If I were you I would go to a physician..even family doctor...and get a referral to a surgeon for a biopsy..that is the only true diagnostic tool as mammograms, u/s, MRIs are only "pictures" you have a lump and bloody nipple discharge which are in need of aggressive diagnoses..I had many abnl mammograms and biopsy of proliferative hyperplasia in both breasts wi th high bc risk..sounds crazy but I had preventive bilateral mastectomy with reconstruction and Â at peace (I am older than you) but bc in young women is usually more aggressive. I would go for another opinion...taking off work is better than having a bad result. Good luck to you..be proactive as it is your health. ..As I said before docs have hundreds of patients....
Posts.Title: 25-Years-Old With Lumps and Bloody Discharge lmartinsound lmartinsound
